quote: Philosophy is the toil which can never tire persons engaged in it. All ways are strewn with roses, and the farther you go, the more enchanting objects appear before you and invite you on.
author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: Philosophy is the music of a judgmental mind and imaginative heart.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Philosophy is an amazing tissue of really fine thinking and incredible, puerile mistakes. It's like one of those rubber 'bones' they give dogs to chew, damned good for the mind's teeth, but as food - no bloody good at all.
author: Olaf Stapledon,  Odd John

quote: Philosophy is the critically reflective, systematically articulated attempt to illumine our human experience in depth and set it in a vision of the whole.
author: W. Norris Clarke,  The One and the Many: A Contemporary Thomistic Metaphysics

quote: Philosophy, as we use the word, is a fight against the fascination which forms of expression exert upon us.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein,  کتاب آبی

quote: The Purpose of Philosophy is to fall in Love. To strip the world of all its clothes, and fall in Love with it as it stand before you completely naked.
author: Ilyas Kassam

quote: Philosophy is one reason which could lead to death.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quote: Philosophy ... is a science, and as such has no articles of faith; accordingly, in it nothing can be assumed as existing except what is either positively given empirically, or demonstrated through indubitable conclusions.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer,  Parerga and Paralipomena

quote: The discovery of what is true and the practice of that which is good are the two most important aims of philosophy.
author: Voltaire

quote: My philosophy, in essence, is the concept of man as a heroic being, with his own happiness as the moral purpose of his life, with productive achievement as his noblest activity, and reason as his only absolute.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Philosophy . . .consists chiefly in suggesting unintelligible answers to insoluble problems.
author: Henry Adams,  The Education of Henry Adams

quote: Philosophy is like wine. There are good years and bad years but, in general, the older the better.
author: Eric Weiner,  The Geography of Genius: A Search for the World's Most Creative Places from Ancient Athens to Silicon Valley

quote: Philosophy begins in wonder. And at the end when philosophic thought has done its best the wonder remains.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Herein lies the supreme wisdom, human and divine; and the task of philosophy consists in teaching men to submit joyously to Necessity which hears nothing and is indifferent to all.
author: Lev Shestov,  Athens and Jerusalem

quote: True philosophy must start from the most immediate and comprehensive fact of consciousness: 'I am life that wants to live, in the midst of life that wants to live
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Philosophy can make people sick.
author: Aristotle,  Nicomachean Ethics

quote: It is the man of science, eager to have his every opinion regenerated, his every idea rationalized, by drinking at the fountain of fact, and devoting all the energies of his life to the cult of truth, not as he understands it, but as he does not yet understand it, that ought properly to be called a philosopher.
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

quote: Philosophy is common sense with big words.
author: James Madison

quote: To study philosophy is nothing but to prepare one’s self to die.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: To make light of philosophy is to be a true philosopher.
author: Blaise Pascal,  Pensées

quote: Science is what you know, philosophy is what you don't know
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Philosophy cannot be taught; it is the application of the sciences to truth.
author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo

quote: ...the only way to judge a philosophy is to examine the lives of those who live it.
author: Karl Friedrich,  Wings: A Novel of World War II Flygirls

quote: To ridicule philosophy is really to philosophize.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Philosophy when superficially studied, excites doubt, when thoroughly explored, it dispels it.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Philosophy cannot and should not give us an account of faith, but should understand itself and know just what it has indeed to offer, without taking anything away, least of all cheating people out of something by making them think it is nothing.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Philosophy is the highest music.
author: Plato

quote: I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: In practice people who study philosophy too long become very odd birds, not to say thoroughly vicious; while even those who are the best of them are reduced by...[philosophy] to complete uselessness as members of society.
author: Plato,  Republic: The Theatre of the Mind

quote: The Study of philosophy is not that we may know what men have thought, but what the truth of things is.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: To be a philosopher is not merely to have subtle thoughts, nor even to found a school, but so to love wisdom as to live according to its dictates, a life of simplicity, independence, magnanimity and trust.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: To be a philosopher, just reverse everything you have ever been told...and have a sense of humor doing it.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Philosophy is really nostalgia, the desire to be at home.
author: Novalis

quote: Despite its successes, in the end, philosophical thinking always falls short of its real goal. It involves both the wonder of aspiring toward the Truth and the distress of falling short of that Truth. In this way, philosophy can be characterized as wondrous distress.
author: John Marmysz,  The Path of Philosophy: Truth, Wonder, and Distress

quote: Philosophy, from the earliest times, has made greater claims, and achieved fewer results, than any other branch of learning.
author: Bertrand Russell,  Our Knowledge of the External World

quote: For this feeling of wonder shows that you are a philosopher, since wonder is the only beginning of philosophy.
author: Plato,  Theaetetus

quote: Philosophers' Syndrome: mistaking a failure of the imagination for an insight into necessity.
author: Daniel C. Dennett,  Consciousness Explained

quote: The philosopher is a person who refuses no pleasures which do not produce greater sorrows, and who knows how to create new ones.
author: Giacomo Casanova

quote: Philosophy without action is the ruin of the soul. One brave deed is worth a hundred books, a thousand theories, a million words. Now as always we need heroes. And heroines! Down with the passive and the limp.
author: Edward Abbey,  Postcards from Ed: Dispatches and Salvos from an American Iconoclast

quote: If you use a philosophy education well, you can get your foot in the door of any industry you please. Industries are like the blossoms on a tree while philosophy is the trunk - it holds the tree together, but it often goes unnoticed.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Philosophers console themselves with explanations.
author: Marty Rubin

quote: The Philosopher's Motto: I came, I saw, I pondered!
author: Greg Curtis

quote: Mere philosophy will not satisfy us. We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved. (3)
author: Swami Satchidananda,  The Yoga Sutras

quote: Every philosophy is a foreground philosophy — that is a hermit's judgment: "There is something arbitrary in his stopping here to look back and look around, in his not digging deeper here but laying his spade aside; there is also something suspicious about it."Every philosophy also conceals a philosophy; every opinion is also a hideout, every word also a mask.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Beyond Good and Evil

quote: The sole remaining task for philosophy is the analysis of language.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Astonishment is the root of philosophy.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: why are we here?where do we come from?traditionally,these are questionsfor philosophy,but philosophy is dead
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: Philosophy cannot be extinguished, though men will try ... The spirit seeks the light, that is its nature. It wishes to return to its origin, and must forever try to reach enlightenment.
author: Iain Pears,  The Dream of Scipio

quote: With a philosophy education, one can infuriate his peers, intimidate his date, think of obscure, unreliable ways to make money, and never regret a thing.
author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality

quote: Science must not impose any philosophy, any more than the telephone must tell us what to say.
author: G.K. Chesterton
